servinfo.title: Steering Upper Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation

attention2.ptxt: Never turn steering wheel while steering upper shaft assembly is removed.

Should it have been turned and contact coil cable assembly have got out of its centered position, it needs to be centered again. Also, turning steering wheel more than about two and a half turns will break contact coil cable assembly.

s1.ptxt: Turn steering wheel so that vehicle’s front tires are at straight-ahead position.
Turn ignition switch to LOCK position and remove key.
Remove steering column assembly from vehicle referring to Steering Column Assembly Removal and Installation .
Make alignment marks (3) on steering upper shaft (2) and steering lower shaft (1) for a guide during reinstallation.
Remove joint bolt (1) and disconnect upper shaft (3) from lower shaft (2).
Remove steering upper shaft mounting bolts (1) (4 pieces).
Remove steering upper shaft assembly from vehicle.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Checking Steering Column for Accident Damage

s1.ptxt: Be sure that front tires and steering wheel are in straight-ahead position.
Install steering upper shaft assembly to dash panel. Tighten steering upper shaft mounting bolts (1) to specified torque.

torqueitem.t-part: Steering upper shaft assembly mounting bolt

s1.ptxt: Install steering column assembly to vehicle referring to Steering Column Assembly Removal and Installation .
Install steering upper shaft (1) to steering lower shaft (2) by matching it to marks (3) made before removal.
Install joint bolt (4). Then tighten it to specified torque.

torqueitem.t-part: Steering upper shaft assembly lower joint bolt
